Translation of 楚竹書・靈王遂申(en) into English.

p.seg: King Ling (of Chu) had just ascended the throne,
and the state of Shen and Xi were unquiet
The king defeated Marquis Ling of Cai at Lu
and ordered all the people of Shen to send out (one member of their families)
to fetch the weapons (?) of Cai
The attendants (from Chu) stood on both sides of the gates of the military camp of Cai
ordering that nobody should dare to get out empty handed
Duke Cheng of Sheng knew that his son Xu had not yet grown his hairs (=was still very young) ,
and (yet) ordered him to go（?)
Xu came out empty handed three times,
(each time) the attendants stopped him.
Xu (then) came riding a cart with four horses
and told the attendants:
I am (too) young,
I am unable to use weapons
I got this carriage,
(but) I might not be able to ride it to go back (to Shen)
(so) he asked to go back (just) with the (carrriage's) whip.
The attendant allowed that.
Xu came back holding the whip.
When he reached Ji Shi (?),
he threw away the whip too. and instructed him earnestly (?)
Duke Ceng feared that he would have to (go back and) take (some weapon) again (?),
scolding him strongly (?):
All the states (or: all the people in the state) have taken everything (they were asked to),
only you did not take anything!
Xu did not answer.
(The father) scolded him again.
